column2: fall in drops （液体）滴下，沥下
column3: e.g. She was hot and sweat [[dripped]] into her eyes.；e.g. Her boots were muddy and her hair was [[dripping]].

column2: let liquid fall in drops 滴（水）；滴下（液体）
column3: e.g. She was hot and sweat [[dripped]] into her eyes.；e.g. Her boots were muddy and her hair was [[dripping]].

column2: 1) breathless 使人喘不过气来的
column3: e.g. She had a car accident and suffered a [[breathtaking]] pain.；e.g. The view from my bedroom window was absolutely [[breathtaking]].

column2: 2) very impressive, exciting, or surprising 激动人心的；惊人的；令人惊叹的
column3: e.g. She had a car accident and suffered a [[breathtaking]] pain.；e.g. The view from my bedroom window was absolutely [[breathtaking]].

column2: [U]  the feeling of being happy and satisfied with your life because you are doing interesting, useful, or important things 成就感；充实感
column3: e.g. Are you looking for greater [[fulfillment]] and satisfaction in your work?

column2: very happy, or likely to make people very happy 欢乐的；令人高兴的
column3: e.g. It was a [[joyful]] reunion of all the family.

column2: 1) (fml.) similar and happening at the same time 相似的；同时发生的
column3: e.g. Social changes in Britain are matched by [[parallel]] trends in some other countries.；e.g. The railway is [[parallel]] with the canal.

column2: 2) two lines, paths, etc. that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart along their whole length 平行的
column3: e.g. Social changes in Britain are matched by [[parallel]] trends in some other countries.；e.g. The railway is [[parallel]] with the canal.

column2: (fml.) bigger, better, or worse than anything else 无比的；无双的；空前的
column3: e.g. They enjoyed success on a scale [[unparalleled]] by any previous pop group.

column2: 1) not pleasant and not sensitive to people's feelings 伤人的；不顾他人感受的
column3: e.g. She spoke with [[brutal]] honesty — I was too old for the job.；e.g. Jensen is a dangerous man, and can be very [[brutal]] and reckless (不顾后果的).

column2: 2) very cruel and violent 野蛮的；凶残的
column3: e.g. She spoke with [[brutal]] honesty — I was too old for the job.；e.g. Jensen is a dangerous man, and can be very [[brutal]] and reckless (不顾后果的).

column2: [U] the quality of being honest 诚实；正直；坦诚
column3: e.g. She answered all my questions with her usual [[honesty]].

column2: too unpleasant, painful, or annoying to deal with 难以忍受的；承受不住的；无法容忍的
column3: e.g. The atmosphere at work at the moment is quite [[unbearable]].

column2: laugh at sb. and make jokes in order to have fun by embarrassing them, either in a friendly way or in an unkind way 戏弄；逗弄；拿···取笑（开玩笑）
column3: e.g. I used to hate being [[teased]] about my red hair when I was at school.

column2: try to make sb. angry or upset by saying unkind things to them （用语言）挑衅，侮辱，嘲弄，奚落
column3: e.g. It's wrong for you to [[taunt]] him because of his size.

column2: 1) make sb. want to have or do sth., even though they know they really should not 诱惑；引诱；诱使
column3: e.g. Don't [[tempt]] thieves by leaving valuables clearly visible.；e.g. They [[tempted]] him to join the company by offering him a large salary and a company car.

column2: 2) try to persuade sb. to do sth. by making it seem attractive 劝说；鼓励
column3: e.g. Don't [[tempt]] thieves by leaving valuables clearly visible.；e.g. They [[tempted]] him to join the company by offering him a large salary and a company car.

column2: always supporting your friends, principles, country, etc. 忠贞的；忠实的；忠诚的
column3: e.g. Jack has been a [[loyal]] worker in this company for almost 50 years.

column2: (usu. in negatives) stop yourself from having sth. that you like very much or doing sth. that you want to do 忍住；按捺
column3: e.g. He was unable to [[resist]] the temptation to buy the wallet.

column2: 1) [C, U] the act of celebrating 庆祝；祝贺；颂扬
column3: e.g. This was not a memorial service but a [[celebration]] of his life.；e.g. There were wild street [[celebrations]] when England won the Cup.

column2: 2) [C] an occasion or party when you celebrate sth. 庆祝会；庆祝活动
column3: e.g. This was not a memorial service but a [[celebration]] of his life.；e.g. There were wild street [[celebrations]] when England won the Cup.

column2: used to say that people or things do sth. or exist together at the same time 与···一起；与···同时
column3: e.g. Most of the staff refused to work [[alongside]] the new team.；e.g. He crossed the street and walked [[alongside]] the park.

column2: next to the side of sth. 在（···）旁边
column3: e.g. Most of the staff refused to work [[alongside]] the new team.；e.g. He crossed the street and walked [[alongside]] the park.

column2: [C, U] an inability to stop doing or using sth., esp. sth. harmful 上瘾
column3: e.g. He is now fighting his [[addiction]] to alcohol.

column2: 1) [C] a pleasant activity 娱乐；消遣
column3: e.g. After a long day of work, I found boating a [[distraction]].；e.g. I study in the library as there are too many [[distractions]] at home.

column2: 2) [C, U] sth. that stops you paying attention to what you are doing 使人分心的事物
column3: e.g. After a long day of work, I found boating a [[distraction]].；e.g. I study in the library as there are too many [[distractions]] at home.

column2: 1) [C, U] the colored part of the sky where the sun is appearing in the morning 日出；晨曦；朝霞
column3: e.g. There was a glorious [[sunrise]] over the mountains.；e.g. They went out at [[sunrise]] to go bird-watching.

column2: 2) [U] the time when the sun first appears in the morning 日出（时分）；黎明；拂晓
column3: e.g. There was a glorious [[sunrise]] over the mountains.；e.g. They went out at [[sunrise]] to go bird-watching.

column2: in a polite, kind, and generous way, esp. to people of a lower rank 有礼貌地，仁慈地，和蔼地，亲切地（尤指对较低阶层的人们）
column3: e.g. Mr. Martel [[graciously]] agreed to take time out of his busy schedule to answer some questions.

column2: 1) make sb. lose their physical strength, or become physically weak （使）（某人）虚弱（衰弱）
column3: e.g. Elsa was [[weakened]] by her long illness.；e.g. The new evidence [[weakens]] the case against her.

column2: 2) make sb. / sth. less powerful or less important, or become less powerful （使）变弱，削弱，减弱
column3: e.g. Elsa was [[weakened]] by her long illness.；e.g. The new evidence [[weakens]] the case against her.

column2: [C] a small raised area on a surface 凸起；隆起； 鼓包
column3: e.g. Her bicycle hit a [[bump]] in the road and threw her off.；e.g. Tim was a clumsy boy, always [[bumping]] into the furniture.

column2: hit or knock against sth. 碰；撞
column3: e.g. Her bicycle hit a [[bump]] in the road and threw her off.；e.g. Tim was a clumsy boy, always [[bumping]] into the furniture.

column2: show or say that sth. will happen in the future 预示；是···的预兆
column3: e.g. The storms of that year [[foreshadowed]] a long period of unstable weather conditions.

column2: 1) (~s) [pl.] the area just outside the lines that form the edge of a sports field （运动场的）场，边
column3: e.g. Wenger stood on the [[sidelines]] shouting instructions to his team.；e.g. Jim works in a bank, but teaches French in the evenings as a [[sideline]].

column2: 2) [C] an activity that you do as well as your main job or business, in order to earn more money 副业；兼职
column3: e.g. Wenger stood on the [[sidelines]] shouting instructions to his team.；e.g. Jim works in a bank, but teaches French in the evenings as a [[sideline]].

column2: always, or for a very long time 永久地；长久地
column3: e.g. Michael and his family have settled [[permanently]] in the States.

column2: (always + ad. / prep.) move back and away from sth., esp. because you are frightened （尤因恐惧而）退缩，畏缩
column3: e.g. His anger was enough to make the others [[shrink away]] from him.；e.g. Your sweater will [[shrink]] if you wash it at too high a temperature.

column2: become smaller, or make sth. smaller, through the effects of heat or water （使）缩小；（使）收缩
column3: e.g. His anger was enough to make the others [[shrink away]] from him.；e.g. Your sweater will [[shrink]] if you wash it at too high a temperature.

column2: try to deal with a difficult problem 处理，对付（难题）
column3: e.g. There is more than one way to [[tackle]] the problem.

column2: [C, U] the possibility that sth. will happen 可能性；希望
column3: e.g. There is every [[prospect]] of the weather remaining dry this week.

column2: 1) a bend in a road, river, etc. （道路、河流等的）弯曲处
column3: e.g. As he rounded the [[curve]] he saw her standing by the gate.；e.g. The seats were arranged to form a [[curve]].

column2: 2) a line that gradually bends like part of a circle 曲线；弧线
column3: e.g. As he rounded the [[curve]] he saw her standing by the gate.；e.g. The seats were arranged to form a [[curve]].

column2: 1) one of a series of small fences that a person or horse has to jump over during a race （跨栏赛跑或马术比赛中用的）栏架
column3: e.g. She cleared all the [[hurdles]] easily and raced to the finishing line.；e.g. Finding enough money for the project was the first [[hurdle]].

column2: 2) a problem or difficulty that you must deal with before you can achieve sth. 障碍；困难
column3: e.g. She cleared all the [[hurdles]] easily and raced to the finishing line.；e.g. Finding enough money for the project was the first [[hurdle]].

column2: [C] (infml.) the end of a marriage or relationship — used esp. in newspapers and magazines 离婚，分手（尤作报刊用语）
column3: e.g. She seems to be getting over her recent [[split]] with her fiancé.；e.g. The party is [[split]] over the issue of immigration.

column2: (split, split) divide, or make a group of people divide, into smaller groups that have very different opinions （组织内部）产生分歧，分裂
column3: e.g. She seems to be getting over her recent [[split]] with her fiancé.；e.g. The party is [[split]] over the issue of immigration.

column2: break or make sth. break, either so that it gets lines on its surface, or so that it breaks into pieces （使）破裂；（使）裂开
column3: e.g. Due to her carelessness, she fell and [[cracked]] a bone in her leg.

column2: having one or more lines on the surface because it is damaged but not completely broken 有裂缝的；有裂痕的
column3: e.g. She passed her tongue over her [[cracked]] lips and tried to speak.

column2: if you do sth. by choice, you do it because you want to do it and not because you are forced to do it 自己选择的；自愿的
column3: e.g. She repeated that she was very comfortable and lived here [[by choice]].

column2: for only sb. to have or use; not shared 独有；专用
column3: e.g. I'm going out, so you'll have the place [[to yourself]].

column2: 1) use all of sth. and not have any more left 用完，耗尽（某物）
column3: e.g. Few of us would know what to do if the supermarkets [[ran out of]] food.；e.g. We must act now because time is [[running out]].

column2: 2) (of a supply of sth.) be used up （供应品）被用完，被耗尽
column3: e.g. Few of us would know what to do if the supermarkets [[ran out of]] food.；e.g. We must act now because time is [[running out]].

column2: (also be sick to death of) (spoken) be angry or bored with sth. that has been happening for a long time 对某事感到气愤（厌倦）
column3: e.g. I'm [[sick of]] your rudeness — I won't have it any longer!

column2: treat sb. badly when you are angry or upset, even though it is not their fault 向（某人）发泄（不满等）；拿（某人）出气
column3: e.g. When he's under pressure at work, he [[takes it out on]] me.

column2: (infml.) a problem that arises and interferes with forward progress (usu. only temporarily) 前进中的问题（通常是暂时的）
column3: e.g. The project hit [[a bump in the road]] when Tom suddenly resigned.

column2: start doing or discussing sth. new 开始做（别的事）；换话题
column3: e.g. When you finish, [[move on]] to the next exercise.

column2: be able to do what you need to do, earn your own money, etc. without help from others 自立；独立自主
column3: e.g. Jack's never learned to [[stand on his own two feet]].

column2: take a long walk in the mountains or countryside （在···）徒步旅行，远足
column3: e.g. His dream is to [[hike]] the world's highest mountain.；e.g. We went for a [[hike]] through the woods on Sunday.

column2: [C] a long walk in the mountains or countryside （在山区或乡间的）徒步旅行，远足
column3: e.g. His dream is to [[hike]] the world's highest mountain.；e.g. We went for a [[hike]] through the woods on Sunday.

column2: [U] 植物学
[U] the state of being kept safe, or the action of keeping sth. safe 安全保管 ; 妥善保管
column3: e.g. My passport was in the inner pocket of my bag, for [[safekeeping]].

column2: [C] a person who is very interested in a particular hobby 爱好者
column3: e.g. The computer [[hobbyists]] are going to love this project.

column2: [C] 松针；松叶
make cloth, a carpet, a basket, etc. by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom 编；织
column3: e.g. This type of wool is [[woven]] into fabric which will make jackets.

column2: if two things merge, or if one thing merges into another, you cannot clearly see them, hear them, etc. as separate things 相融；融入；渐渐消失在另一物中
column3: e.g. The hills [[merged]] into the dark sky behind them.；e.g. The banks are set to [[merge]] next year.

column2: combine, or join things together to form one thing 合并；融合
column3: e.g. The hills [[merged]] into the dark sky behind them.；e.g. The banks are set to [[merge]] next year.

column2: not able to be identified as different or distinct 难以分辨的；难以区分的
column3: e.g. The male of the species is almost [[indistinguishable]] from the female.

column2: [U] the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, esp. in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them 生产率；生产效率；生产量；生产力
column3: e.g. Studies show that if a working environment is pleasant, [[productivity]] increases.

column2: a new business activity that involves taking risks 风险项目；风险投资；冒险事业
column3: e.g. The company's latest [[venture]] in the tech industry proved to be a success.

column2: 1) the state of being weak or uncertain, and likely to become worse under pressure （形式）脆弱，不稳定
column3: e.g. The collapse of the bank is a reminder of the [[fragility]] of the world’s banking system.；e.g. A deficiency of copper (缺铜) can cause increased bone [[fragility]].

column2: 2) the state of being easily broken or damaged 脆弱；易碎；易损坏
column3: e.g. The collapse of the bank is a reminder of the [[fragility]] of the world’s banking system.；e.g. A deficiency of copper (缺铜) can cause increased bone [[fragility]].

column2: 1) easy to obtain or use 易得到的；易使用的
column3: e.g. I had to keep the video camera readily [[accessible]] in case I saw something that needed to be filmed.；e.g. The remote desert area is only [[accessible]] by helicopter (直升机).

column2: 2) easy to reach or get into 易到达的；易进入的
column3: e.g. I had to keep the video camera readily [[accessible]] in case I saw something that needed to be filmed.；e.g. The remote desert area is only [[accessible]] by helicopter (直升机).

column2: [C] a big company, or a group of companies acting together as a single organization 大型公司；企业集团
column3: e.g. She didn't want to work for a big [[corporation]] where everything was so impersonal.

column2: 1) available to be used 可以使用的
column3: e.g. The nation's [[disposable]] earnings amounted to 586 billion dollars.；e.g. She joined Kiley at the counter, holding a [[disposable]] cup with coffee in it.

column2: 2) intended to be used once or for a short time and then thrown away 一次性的；用完即弃的
column3: e.g. The nation's [[disposable]] earnings amounted to 586 billion dollars.；e.g. She joined Kiley at the counter, holding a [[disposable]] cup with coffee in it.

column2: [C] 游乐场
1) start to exist; appear or become known 兴起；开始被人所知
column3: e.g. The state [[emerges]] as a leader in the field of next-generation energy.；e.g. The doors opened and people began to [[emerge]] into the street.

column2: 2) appear or come out from somewhere 出现；浮现
column3: e.g. The state [[emerges]] as a leader in the field of next-generation energy.；e.g. The doors opened and people began to [[emerge]] into the street.

column2: [C] a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people 特权；特殊待遇
column3: e.g. Senior management enjoys certain [[privileges]], such as company cars and private health care.

column2: 1) (the ~) [pl.] people who have a lot of money, possessions, etc. 有钱人；富人
column3: e.g. The best education should not be available only to the [[wealthy]].；e.g. He left as a poor, working class boy and returned as an extremely [[wealthy]] man.

column2: 2) having a lot of money, possessions, etc. 富有的；有钱的
column3: e.g. The best education should not be available only to the [[wealthy]].；e.g. He left as a poor, working class boy and returned as an extremely [[wealthy]] man.

column2: (of a device or process) working by itself with little or no direct human control （装置或流程）自动的
column3: e.g. The door we escaped through had an [[automatic]] lock but we didn't know that.

column2: the state of being successful, esp. financially 兴隆；发达；繁荣；昌盛
column3: e.g. A country's future [[prosperity]] depends, to an extent, upon the quality of education of its people.

column2: [U] a political situation in which people protest or behave violently 动荡；动乱；骚动
column3: e.g. Due to the economic downturn, there's growing social [[unrest]] in the country.

column2: [C, U] a situation in which there is not enough of sth. that people need 短缺；不足；缺乏
column3: e.g. The long hot summer has led to serious water [[shortages]].

column2: [C, U] a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity, etc. in a country than usual （经济）衰退，萧条
column3: e.g. We should concentrate on sharply reducing interest rates to pull the economy out of [[recession]].

column2: unhappy or not satisfied with the situation you are in 不满的；不满足的；不愉快的
column3: e.g. He felt [[discontented]] with the way his life had turned out.

column2: giving pleasure 令人愉快的；令人快乐的
column3: e.g. We spent an [[enjoyable]] evening talking about old times.

column2: certain to happen and impossible to avoid 必然发生的；不可避免的
column3: e.g. It was an [[inevitable]] consequence of the decision.

column2: consider that two things are similar or connected 使等同；同等看待
column3: e.g. Some people [[equate]] fame with success, but I don't think so.

column2: (only before noun) having two of sth. or two parts 双的；双重的；两部分的
column3: e.g. The piece of furniture serves a [[dual]] purpose as a cupboard and as a table.

column2: [U] (fml.) the state of having two of sth. or two parts 双重性
column3: e.g. His poems reveal the [[duality]] of his nature, the joy and hope, the fear and despair.

column2: having a strong belief that everything can be perfect, often in a way that does not seem to be realistic or practical 乌托邦的；空想完美主义的
column3: e.g. He was pursuing a [[utopian]] dream of world prosperity.

column2: [C] (mainly AmE, infml.) a piece of work or a job that you get paid for doing in addition to doing your main job 副业
column3: e.g. Even if you love your job and find your work fulfilling, you can still benefit from a [[side hustle]].

column2: (fml.) concerning sb.  sth. 关于
column3: e.g. [[Regarding]] your recent inquiry, I have sent you a copy of our new brochure.

column2: 1) the point at which one feeling, idea, quality, etc. stops and another starts （不同情感、思想、品质等之间的）分野，分界线
column3: e.g. The [[boundaries]] between history and storytelling are always being blurred.；e.g. The Mississippi River forms a natural [[boundary]] between Iowa and Illinois.

column2: 2) the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country, etc., or the edge of an area of land that belongs to sb. 分界线；边界
column3: e.g. The [[boundaries]] between history and storytelling are always being blurred.；e.g. The Mississippi River forms a natural [[boundary]] between Iowa and Illinois.

column2: 1) relating to the practice of emptying your mind of thoughts and feelings, in order to relax completely or for religious reasons 冥想的；默想的
column3: e.g. She closed her eyes and went into a [[meditative]] state.；e.g. When he entered the room, she was in a [[meditative]] mood.

column2: 2) thinking deeply and seriously about sth.; involving deep thought 深思的；沉思的；思考的
column3: e.g. She closed her eyes and went into a [[meditative]] state.；e.g. When he entered the room, she was in a [[meditative]] mood.

column2: [C]  (esp. AmE) the amount of wages sb. earns 薪金；工资
column3: e.g. The new bill could mean a larger [[paycheck]] for state employees.

column2: spoil or destroy sth. completely 毁坏；毁掉；糟蹋
column3: e.g. Huge modern hotels have [[ruined]] this once undisturbed coastline.

column2: [U] the quality or state of being pure 纯；纯洁；洁净；纯正；纯粹
column3: e.g. The color white is the color of [[purity]] and that is why women typically wear white when they get married.

column2: improve sth. 改善；改进
column3: e.g. The measures taken should considerably [[enhance]] the residents' quality of life.

column2: essentially or innately 生性
column3: e.g. She was [[by nature]] a very sensitive person.

column1: have a hard time doing sth.
column2: be difficult for sb. to do sth. 做某事很难
column3: e.g. I [[had a hard time]] persuading him to accept the offer.

column2: cause sb. to do sth. 导致某人做某事
column3: e.g. What [[led]] him to reconsider his position?

column2: depend on sb. to provide help, advice, etc. 指望；依靠
column3: e.g. They're [[looking to]] the new manager to make the company profitable.
